We are Spectrum Books Limited! SBL is driven by excellence, and is passionate about transforming lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Assistant

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

	Excellent documentation and reporting skills

QHSE Officer Job at Fadac Resources and Services Limited




        
    

        
        Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client, a leading group of companies in Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QHSE Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To ensure consistent implementation of QHSE standards across all assigned stations through inspections, training, coaching, risk assessments, and performance monitoring, in line with regulatory, internal requirements and international standards.


Job Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Conduct quarterly inspections of 100% of assigned stations using approved checklists (e.g., Microsoft Forms).
	Maintain and update risk assessments and regulatory compliance registers for all assigned stations. Provide quarterly updates to the QHSE Manager.
	Review and rate Station Managers’ QHSE KPIs during visits. Ensure a minimum score of 80% per station.
	Track and support closure of corrective actions from internal and external audits. Ensure at least 90% closure within set timelines.
	Share monthly QHSE performance updates (e.g., IMS audit scores) for all assigned stations.
	Conduct at least one mock drill per quarter at each station. Raise staff awareness and readiness for emergencies.
	Provide on-the-spot coaching to Station Managers and station staff during visits. Deliver at least one training session per Station Manager monthly.
	Submit all inspection and performance reports within 48 hours of visit. Maintain 100% report submission compliance.
	Oversee contractor safety management at all retail stations undergoing renovation.
	Represent the department on IMS audit activities.
	Coordinate IMS documentation, implementation & audit-related activities in all assigned stations.
	Provide adequate assistance to external auditors in compliance reviews.
	Participate in all internal audits, report writing, and presentations at the monthly meetings
	Participate in all other cross-functional assigned duties and engagements


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Sciences or in an HSE-related field
	2-3 years of experience in similar roles
	International and Local certifications as well as HSE Related training
	Strong knowledge of HSE regulations and industry standards
	Effective communication and coaching skills Analytical and problem-solving abilities
	Excellent documentation and reporting skills
	Good knowledge of Integrated Management Systems (IMS)
	Ability to travel and manage multi-site responsibilities
	Contractor safety Management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: susan.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "DrugStoc is a secure and interactive procurement platform that empowers healthcare providers by giving access to safe and quality pharmaceutical products through a consolidated supply chain system.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Financial Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job&nbsp;Summary


	We are seeking a visionary and strategic Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to join our leadership team in a fast-growing Tech-Pharmaceutical company.
	The CFO will be responsible for providing strategic financial direction, driving business growth, ensuring sound financial management, and strengthening investor and stakeholder relations.
	The ideal candidate should have a strong background in finance leadership within technology, pharmaceuticals, or FMCG, and a proven track record of managing financial operations in high-growth and innovation-driven environments.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership &amp; Financial Planning:


	Develop and execute financial strategies aligned with the company&rsquo;s long-term goals.
	Partner with the CEO and executive team to drive growth, profitability, and expansion.
	Provide insights and recommendations to support data-driven decision-making.


Financial Management &amp; Reporting:


	Oversee all aspects of financial management including budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis, and reporting.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, tax laws, and industry-specific financial standards.
	Implement robust internal controls, risk management frameworks, and governance policies.


Capital Management &amp; Fundraising:


	Lead fundraising initiatives including equity, debt financing, and strategic investments.
	Manage relationships with investors, banks, financial institutions, and external auditors.
	Optimize capital structure to support scalability and expansion.


Operational &amp; Business Support:


	Drive efficiency in financial operations, leveraging technology and automation.
	Support new product launches, R&amp;D investment decisions, and go-to-market strategies.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Tech, R&amp;D, Sales, Supply Chain) to align financial goals with operational execution.


People &amp; Leadership:


	Lead, mentor, and develop the finance team to build a high-performing function.
	Foster a culture of accountability, integrity, and continuous improvement.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field (MBA or Master&rsquo;s preferred).
	Minimum of 10 &ndash; 15 years of progressive financial leadership experience, with at least 5 years in a CFO or senior finance leadership role.
	Professional certification such as ACA, ACCA, CPA, or CFA required.
	Strong experience in Tech, Pharmaceutical, or FMCG industries is highly desirable.
	Proven track record in fundraising, M&amp;A, and investor relations.
	Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, innovation-driven, and highly regulated environment.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic vision with hands-on execution ability.
	Strong leadership and team-building skills.
	High integrity and sound judgment.
	Business acumen with strong commercial awareness.
	Change management and adaptability in dynamic environments.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their&nbsp;CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;h.oseni@drugstoc.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
